preqs: MTH1010 or VCE Mathematical Methods units 3 and 4 with a study score of at least 25

rules.ruleString: Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ENG1005, ENG1090, MAT1841, MTH1030, MTH1035, MTH1055}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ENG1005, ENG1090, MAT1841, MTH1030, MTH1035, MTH1055}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ENG1090, MAT1055, MTH1030, MTH1035, MTH1055}

proh: ENG1090, ENG1091, ENG1005, MAT1841, MTH1055, MTH1030 and MTH1035. Note that MTH1020 can only be completed prior to MTH1030 or MTH1035 and students who have already completed one of these cannot enrol subsequently in MTH1020.
description: Properties of real and complex numbers; algebraic functions and common transcendental functions; modelling change using elementary functions; limits and continuity; rate of change, derivatives, local and global extrema; sums and integrals, anti-derivatives, calculus applications: optimisation, area and volume, introduction to differential equations; Vectors in two- and three- dimensional space.
